channel.title: New CEO of Jagex
channel.description:
Apparently Jagex has hired a new CEO, you can read his news post [url=http://news.runescape.com/newsitem.ws?id=1648]here[/url] and about him being appointed [url=http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/Jagex-Ltd-943527.html]here[/url].
What do you guys think about this?

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @skiller_noob1 skiller noob1
item.description:
@skiller_noob1 wrote:

This is MITB we make things more complicated than we need to.

Read full topic

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:20, topic:261392”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=345193.msg2663501#msg2663501 date=1234387434]

Blocking adds is against the rules: http://www.runescape.com/kbase/viewarticle.ws?article_id=2396 But I see your point mopar! Genius!

Disabling javascript isn’t against the rules is it? And without javascript they can’t see that my custom CSS makes the ad divs hidden can they? Right?
[/quote]
why not just use ad block?[/quote]

Adblock doesn’t get rid of the div, so instead of an ad there is an equally sized black box, still just as annoying. Plus they can (and do!) detect that adblock is used with javascript.

Read full topic

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:261392”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=345193.msg2663394#msg2663394 date=1234382316]
Blocking adds is against the rules: http://www.runescape.com/kbase/viewarticle.ws?article_id=2396 But I see your point mopar! Genius!
[/quote]

Disabling javascript isn’t against the rules is it? And without javascript they can’t see that my custom CSS makes the ad divs hidden can they? Right? :D[/quote]
why not just use ad block?

Read full topic

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Tico135:

[quote]A good example of this is that a lot of free players told us they found our video adverts before the game annoying to the point it was putting them off playing, so we’ve scrapped them with immediate effect. We now appreciate that it can be frustrating having to sit through a video advert when you just want to play RuneScape, so we have to put our hands up to admit we made a mistake and say that we’re sorry. To be completely candid with you, video adverts generate significantly more revenue than other adverts, but as one of our fundamental philosophies is that having fun is more important to us than making as much money as possible, we have removed video adverts from the game.

Woah; Jagex apologizing? It’s about time they stopped worrying so much about the money; they have enough of it anyways.[/quote]

Who ever watched them anyway? Disabling javascript is not against the rules and stops annoying things like ads and such. Some quick CSS blocks the entire ad panel anyway (undetectably as well). Then playing free works the same as paying, with full screen mode if you want it.

Anyway, it’ll be interesting to see if he does anything.

Read full topic

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

No, he enforced the removal of the video-ads, hence he did something to runescape.

Read full topic

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Mopman is right, His job will be to carry out the strategic plans and policies as established by the board of directors. In this case, he will report to the directors, Andrew and Paul.

Read full topic

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

No, he posted a news item. Its pretty common for new CEOs to tell everyone hwo theyre gonna make a difference, and do a few small things, until the tedium sets in

Read full topic

item.title: New CEO of Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

A good example of this is that a lot of free players told us they found our video adverts before the game annoying to the point it was putting them off playing, so we've scrapped them with immediate effect. We now appreciate that it can be frustrating having to sit through a video advert when you just want to play RuneScape, so we have to put our hands up to admit we made a mistake and say that we're sorry. To be completely candid with you, video adverts generate significantly more revenue than other adverts, but as one of our fundamental philosophies is that having fun is more important to us than making as much money as possible, we have removed video adverts from the game.

Woah; Jagex apologizing? It’s about time they stopped worrying so much about the money; they have enough of it anyways.

Read full topic
